p: In a pole figure, the spatial distribution of the pole directions of certain net planes (defined by a distinct q value or a q range with a certain width) is plotted in a single polar plot with the radius being Ψ and the azimuthal part Φ ( cf. Fig. 3 ▸, inset) and the measured intensity is colour coded. For practical reasons, a stereographic projection is chosen for visualization. In GIDVis, pole figures can be calculated from the experimental GIXD patterns and visualized directly. The data can also be converted for analysis with other software (Salzmann & Resel, 2004 ▸) to determine the epitaxial relationship between the adsorbate and substrate and to obtain the orientation distribution function (ODF) (Alexander, 1979 ▸; Suwas & Ray, 2014 ▸).
